subject: Ethics
title: Feedback Loops Amplify Inequality
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Feedback Loops Amplify Inequality.

hook.text: A bank's AI denies loans in poor neighborhoods. Property values drop. The AI sees riskier data. Denies more.

buildup.text: Algorithmic feedback loops happen when an AI's output becomes its own future input.

discovery.text: Each cycle amplifies the original bias. Small initial errors compound into massive systemic inequality.

twist.text: The people harmed never see the algorithm. They just get the rejection letter, again and again.

climax.text: Breaking the loop requires human interventionâ€”someone must audit the system and inject fresh, fair data.

punchline.text: Bias doesn't just repeat. In a loop, it multiplies.

quiz.question: How do algorithmic feedback loops affect inequality?
options: They gradually reduce bias over time
They have no measurable effect on outcomes
They amplify small initial biases into large systemic disparities
